trans-unit.source: Manage a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Manage a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Links to resources for managing a web app in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Links to resources for managing a web app in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Manage a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Manage a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: This topic contains links to resources for managing a web app in [Azure App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714).
trans-unit.target: This topic contains links to resources for managing a web app in [Azure App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714).

trans-unit.source: Management includes all of the tasks that keep your web app running smoothly.
trans-unit.target: Management includes all of the tasks that keep your web app running smoothly.

trans-unit.source: Over the lifetime of a web app, you will perform different management tasks, as you move from initial deployment to normal operation, maintenance, and updates.
trans-unit.target: Over the lifetime of a web app, you will perform different management tasks, as you move from initial deployment to normal operation, maintenance, and updates.

trans-unit.source: Many web app management tasks can be performed in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Many web app management tasks can be performed in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Before you deploy your web app to production
trans-unit.target: Before you deploy your web app to production

trans-unit.source: Choose a tier
trans-unit.target: Choose a tier

trans-unit.source: Azure App Service is offered in five tiers: Free, Shared, Basic, Standard, and Premium.
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service is offered in five tiers: Free, Shared, Basic, Standard, and Premium.

trans-unit.source: For information about the features and pricing for each tier, see [Pricing details](/pricing/details/app-service/).
trans-unit.target: For information about the features and pricing for each tier, see [Pricing details](/pricing/details/app-service/).

trans-unit.source: [App Service plans](../app-service/azure-web-sites-web-hosting-plans-in-depth-overview.md) let you group multiple web apps under the same tier.
trans-unit.target: [App Service plans](../app-service/azure-web-sites-web-hosting-plans-in-depth-overview.md) let you group multiple web apps under the same tier.

trans-unit.source: You can always [switch tiers](web-sites-scale.md) after you create your web app.
trans-unit.target: You can always [switch tiers](web-sites-scale.md) after you create your web app.

trans-unit.source: Configuration
trans-unit.target: Configuration

trans-unit.source: Use the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/) to set various configuration options.
trans-unit.target: Use the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/) to set various configuration options.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Configure web apps in Azure App Service](web-sites-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Configure web apps in Azure App Service](web-sites-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Here is a quick checklist:
trans-unit.target: Here is a quick checklist:

trans-unit.source: Select **runtime versions** for .NET, PHP, Java, or Python, if needed.
trans-unit.target: Select **runtime versions** for .NET, PHP, Java, or Python, if needed.

trans-unit.source: Enable **WebSockets** if your web app uses the WebSocket protocol.
trans-unit.target: Enable **WebSockets** if your web app uses the WebSocket protocol.

trans-unit.source: (This includes apps that use [ASP.NET SignalR](http://www.asp.net/signalr) or [socket.io](web-sites-nodejs-chat-app-socketio.md).)
trans-unit.target: (This includes apps that use [ASP.NET SignalR](http://www.asp.net/signalr) or [socket.io](web-sites-nodejs-chat-app-socketio.md).)

trans-unit.source: Are you running continuous web jobs?
trans-unit.target: Are you running continuous web jobs?

trans-unit.source: If so, enable **Always On**.
trans-unit.target: If so, enable **Always On**.

trans-unit.source: Set the **default document**, such as index.html.
trans-unit.target: Set the **default document**, such as index.html.

trans-unit.source: In addition to these basic configuration settings, you may want to configure the following:
trans-unit.target: In addition to these basic configuration settings, you may want to configure the following:

trans-unit.source: **Secure Socket Layer (SSL)** encryption.
trans-unit.target: **Secure Socket Layer (SSL)** encryption.

trans-unit.source: To use SSL with a custom domain name, you must get an SSL certificate and configure your web app to use it.
trans-unit.target: To use SSL with a custom domain name, you must get an SSL certificate and configure your web app to use it.

trans-unit.source: See [Enable HTTPS for a web app in Azure App Service](web-sites-configure-ssl-certificate.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Enable HTTPS for a web app in Azure App Service](web-sites-configure-ssl-certificate.md).

trans-unit.source: Custom domain name.
trans-unit.target: Custom domain name.

trans-unit.source: Your web app automatically has a subdomain under azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: Your web app automatically has a subdomain under azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: You can associate a custom domain name, such as contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: You can associate a custom domain name, such as contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: See [Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service](web-sites-custom-domain-name.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Configure a custom domain name in Azure App Service](web-sites-custom-domain-name.md).

trans-unit.source: Language-specific configuration:
trans-unit.target: Language-specific configuration:

trans-unit.source: **PHP**: [Configure PHP in Azure App Service Web Apps](web-sites-php-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: **PHP**: [Configure PHP in Azure App Service Web Apps](web-sites-php-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: **Python**: [Configuring Python with Azure App Service Web Apps](web-sites-python-configure.md)
trans-unit.target: **Python**: [Configuring Python with Azure App Service Web Apps](web-sites-python-configure.md)

trans-unit.source: While your web app is running
trans-unit.target: While your web app is running

trans-unit.source: While your web app is running, you want to make sure it is available, and that it scales to meet user traffic.
trans-unit.target: While your web app is running, you want to make sure it is available, and that it scales to meet user traffic.

trans-unit.source: You may also need to troubleshoot errors.
trans-unit.target: You may also need to troubleshoot errors.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring
trans-unit.target: Monitoring

trans-unit.source: Through the Azure preview portal, you can [add performance metrics](web-sites-monitor.md) such as CPU usage and number of client requests.
trans-unit.target: Through the Azure preview portal, you can [add performance metrics](web-sites-monitor.md) such as CPU usage and number of client requests.

trans-unit.source: For deeper insight, use New Relic to monitor and manage performance.
trans-unit.target: For deeper insight, use New Relic to monitor and manage performance.

trans-unit.source: See [.NET web app in Azure App Service with New Relic application performance management](store-new-relic-web-sites-dotnet-application-performance-management.md).
trans-unit.target: See [.NET web app in Azure App Service with New Relic application performance management](store-new-relic-web-sites-dotnet-application-performance-management.md).

trans-unit.source: [Scale your web app](web-sites-scale.md) in response to traffic.
trans-unit.target: [Scale your web app](web-sites-scale.md) in response to traffic.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your tier, you can scale the number of VMs and/or the size of the VM instances.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your tier, you can scale the number of VMs and/or the size of the VM instances.

trans-unit.source: In the Standard and Premium tiers, you can also set up autoscaling, so your web app scales automatically, either on a fixed schedule, or in response to load.
trans-unit.target: In the Standard and Premium tiers, you can also set up autoscaling, so your web app scales automatically, either on a fixed schedule, or in response to load.

trans-unit.source: Backups
trans-unit.target: Backups

trans-unit.source: Set [automatic backups](web-sites-backup.md) of your web app.
trans-unit.target: Set [automatic backups](web-sites-backup.md) of your web app.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about backups in [this video](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/azure-websites-automatic-and-easy-backup/).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about backups in [this video](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/azure-websites-automatic-and-easy-backup/).

trans-unit.source: Learn about the options for [database recovery](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh852669.aspx) in Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the options for [database recovery](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh852669.aspx) in Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: If something goes wrong, you can [troubleshoot in Visual Studio](web-sites-dotnet-troubleshoot-visual-studio.md#remotedebug), using diagnostic logs and live debugging in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: If something goes wrong, you can [troubleshoot in Visual Studio](web-sites-dotnet-troubleshoot-visual-studio.md#remotedebug), using diagnostic logs and live debugging in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Outside of Visual Studio, there are various ways to collect diagnostic logs.
trans-unit.target: Outside of Visual Studio, there are various ways to collect diagnostic logs.

trans-unit.source: See [Enable diagnostics logging for web apps in Azure App Service](web-sites-enable-diagnostic-log.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Enable diagnostics logging for web apps in Azure App Service](web-sites-enable-diagnostic-log.md).

trans-unit.source: For Node.js applications, see [How to debug a Node.js web app in Azure App Service](web-sites-nodejs-debug.md).
trans-unit.target: For Node.js applications, see [How to debug a Node.js web app in Azure App Service](web-sites-nodejs-debug.md).

trans-unit.source: Restoring Data
trans-unit.target: Restoring Data

trans-unit.source: [Restore](web-sites-restore.md) a web app that was previously backed up.
trans-unit.target: [Restore](web-sites-restore.md) a web app that was previously backed up.

trans-unit.source: When you update your web app
trans-unit.target: When you update your web app

trans-unit.source: If you have not enabled automatic backups, you can create a [manual backup](web-sites-backup.md).
trans-unit.target: If you have not enabled automatic backups, you can create a [manual backup](web-sites-backup.md).

trans-unit.source: Consider using [staged deployment](web-sites-staged-publishing.md).
trans-unit.target: Consider using [staged deployment](web-sites-staged-publishing.md).

trans-unit.source: This option lets you publish updates to a staging deployment that runs side-by-side with your production deployment.
trans-unit.target: This option lets you publish updates to a staging deployment that runs side-by-side with your production deployment.

trans-unit.source: If you use Visual Studio Online, you can set up continuous deployment from source control:
trans-unit.target: If you use Visual Studio Online, you can set up continuous deployment from source control:

trans-unit.source: Using Team Foundation Version Control (TFVC)
trans-unit.target: Using Team Foundation Version Control (TFVC)

trans-unit.source: Using Git
trans-unit.target: Using Git

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
